Spring Lake Village is a premier senior living community in Santa Rosa, CA. Our residents love living here, and you will love working here.Â 

We are seeking a passionate professional as a Social Services Coordinator/Designee to join our team in the onsite Health Care Center.

Summary:Â 

The Social Services Coordinator assists staff, residents and residentsâ€™ families in understanding and coping with a resident's personal, emotional and related health and environmental issues within the Skilled Nursing facility, ensuring that the needs of residents are met and maintained.Â She or he is the voice of the resident when the resident has lost the capacity to speak for himself or herself.Â 

A Few Key Responsibilities:Â 

  • Expresses a philosophy of person-centered, long-term care based on individual resident needs, preferences and choices.
  • Ensures quality care and resident rights are respected at all times in SNF.Â 
  • Participates in care plan conferences and regularly evaluates care plans for effectiveness.
  • Interacts and communicates regularly with all health Services Staff, residents, families physicians, and external providers.
  • Serves as an advocate for the resident and is notified and follows up with any issues related to the psychosocial well-being and mood state of each resident.
  • Models professional behavior and coaches and mentors staff to develop maximum potential.
  • Communicates effectively with staff, colleagues and supervisors; maintains positive communication and team relationships in the SNF.
  • Develops a Social Services plan, including goals and treatments for each resident who needs such services; incorporates input from resident, family, residentâ€™s care physician and the interdisciplinary team.Â 
  • Demonstrates basic knowledge of the aging process, including misconceptions, physical changes and psychosocial aspects.Â 
  • Understands applicable state and federal regulations; demonstrates understanding of rights of individuals who reside in long-term care.Â 
  • Understands and follows the admission and discharge processes.Â 

A Few Must Haves:

  • A minimum of one year experience working a social services coordinator in a long term care facility.
  • Social services designee certification
  • Good understanding of long-term care, MDS, Medicare, Title 22 and OBRA regulations.
  • Willing to multitask, be a team player, and follow-up timely with supervisor directives.

Under the direction of the Executive Director, the Director of Human Resources provides service and support to all community employees and guidance and support to management and supervisory staff regarding human resources issues, including employee relations, policy interpretation, salary, wage and benefit administration, recruitment and selection, training, safety and workersâ€™ compensation. Demonstrates ability to interpret company policies and procedures and ensures managers and employees understand and adhere to them. This position has full responsibility for all HR functions in the community.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

  • Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.
  • Provides employee relations support to all community employees. Provides advice and counsel to managers and supervisors on employee-related concerns as per company work rules. Facilitates internal investigations following allegations of employee misconduct and maintains records of such investigations. Coordinates corrective actions taken, as per company and department policies.
  • Facilitates the hiring process, adhering to the New Hire Check list, including recruitment advertising, job offers, reference checks, pre-employment drug, health & criminal record clearance, work authorization (I-9s) and work permits. Participates in interview and selection process for key community personnel, including administrative and leadership positions.
  • Provides training in such areas as new employee orientation, supervisor training, safety training, and mandated Federal, State, and company compliance training. Coordinates department-specific and ongoing training with department managers/supervisors.
  • Administers employee benefit plans for Health, Dental, Vision, Life/ADD, and LTD plans, including COBRA administration. Maintains record of insurance coverage, and processes monthly invoices to balance with company and employee-paid premiums.
  • Manages Injury and Illness Prevention Program. Investigates accidents and prepares reports for insurance carrier. Manages workers compensation claims, return to work/transitional duty program in accordance with company policy. Facilitates monthly IIPP meetings, participates in and/or leads safety committee creating a safety culture within the community.
  • Approves and processes employee separations, including exit interviews. Identifies turnover trends and reacts accordingly with community leadership team. Represents community at unemployment hearings.
  • Manages employee evaluation/Pay for Performance process. Prepares and processes wage and status changes, coordinating with department managers and supervisors, Executive Director, and Home Office HR team. Participates in local wage surveys, ensuring competitive pay and benefit ranges are in place.
  • Manages and/or completes bi-weekly payroll processing, including employee timekeeping, commissions, and bonus payments. Ensures compliance with all wage and hour laws. Works with department leadership and Executive Director to manage overtime and other payroll issues.
  • May act as community Point Person for Service Excellence program, working with SEAs to plan and schedule workshops and other program meetings.
  • Manages employee recognition programs, including Employee of the Month, safety, all-staff meetings, employee parties and other appreciation events to promote increased retention.
  • Serves as part of community leadership, participating in interdisciplinary teams such as resident assessment council, director on duty, marketing/occupancy efforts and social accountability.
  • Supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws including interviewing, hiring and training employees, planning, assigning and directing work, appraising performance, rewarding and disciplining employees, addressing complaints and resolving problems.
  • Follows all federal, state and company policies, health codes and guidelines.
  • Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.
  • Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.
Job Requirements and Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree (B.A.) from a college or university; or 1-2 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures and governmental regulations; ability to write reports and business correspondence; ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public.
  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals; ability to compute rate, ratio and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
  • Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form; ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
  • Must have good communication and customer service skills; ability to work well with others and take direction; ability to work under pressure to ensure timely review, correction and reporting of the payroll. This position will also assist account payable and accounts receivable with imputing data, preparing bank deposits, etc.

    Must have the ability to focus on details with regard to procedures and workflow and to think rationally and make decisions logically.

Spring Lake Village is a welcoming, vibrant, upscale retirement community that values our residents and one another. Surrounded by parks and vineyards and bounded by Santa Rosa Creek, at Spring Lake Village, our residents love living here and you will love working here!

Summary:

Under some supervision and according to prescribed standards, the Housekeeper/Laundry Aide provides cleaning to all areas of the community, as well as sorts, tracks and delivers laundry within the community and performs other duties as assigned.

General Responsibilities:

Clean and sanitize residences and contents, including, but not limited to, vacuuming, dusting, cleaning kitchen and bath fixtures, turning mattresses, moving light furniture, emptying trash receptacles
Other cleaning duties for resident apartments, offices, bathrooms, and other common areas in the community
Assist with cleaning and refurbishing of vacated residences as they become vacant
Wash, dry, fold, and store linens and other laundry of the community and residents
Coordinate delivery and return of resident laundry
Keep housekeeping carts clean and organized
Keep carts stocked with appropriate cleaning supplies in OSHA-approved containers
Perform all other duties as assigned


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Must be able to read, write, and communicate effectively with residents, families, guests, and other associates in English
Ability to work safely with cleaning chemicals, as well as being exposed to chemical fumes, dust, and pet dander
Frequently required to stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, and crawl
Occasionally required to lift and/or move 30 pounds and push or pull up to 75 pounds


Education and Other Qualifications:

Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment. Employment contingent upon fingerprint clearance from the Department of Justice.

Summary:

The Resident Services Coordinator (RSC) is responsible for assessing and identifying resident needs that focuses on housing success. The RSC will work in a proactive manner to link elderly, people with disabilities and low-income families to supportive services and other community resources. This position must be in full compliance with HIPPA. This position will help support 3 communities.

Responsibilities:

Â· Provide non-clinical case management and referral services to all resident site (s), which includes securing the full range of social services as needed by individual residents.

Â· Assess and identify resident needs, develop and implement individual healthy aging plans, actively motivate and educate residents on self-management of chronic conditions, and in close collaboration with hospitals and nursing homes.

Â· Conduct initial assessment within 30 days of moved-in and update assessment including update Intake, Individual, ADL annually or as needed on ADL.

Â· Utilize and maintain accurate and timely documentation through AASC On-Line. Conduct initial resident assessment within 30 days of move in. Update assessment as needed. Submission of weekly report to housing administrator and supervisor.

Â· Organize and coordinate on-site wellness and health improvement programs, events and activities. Educate residents on wellness programs such as service availability, benefits, fall prevention, chronic diseases or tools for healthy living.

Â· Produce weekly report and timely submit to Housing Administrator, immediate supervisor, and contractorâ€™s request and HUD annual SfS (Standards for Success) Report.

Â· Conduct outreach and engagement, monitoring service periodically, home visits when needed.

Â· Work closely with Activities Coordinator (if applicable) to develop a wide range of activities within and outside the site, designed to build community and provide opportunities for socialization and wellness that is mutually beneficial to residents.

Â· Create with volunteer to establish volunteer support programs.

Â· Collaborate and sustain constructive relationships with residents and their families, service providers, organization staff, especially those in property management.

Â· Maintain accurately and timely documentation on all resident demographics, issues, requests, incidents, interactions and outcomes through online software (AASC Online).

Â· Maintain updated residentsâ€™ files and resources directory through online software (AASC Online).

Â· Attend staff meeting and Resident Services Coordinator on-going training and/or conference.

Â· Assist residents in identifying and accessing needed services and benefits, and serve as a liaison or advocate for residents when help is needed to secure resources.

Â· Maintain resident confidentiality with the resident population according to set guidelines. Report incidents of abuse and neglect to Adult and Child Protective Services as required by law.

Â· Establish informal and formal partnerships with health and supportive service agencies in the community to ensure that services are available and delivered in a timely and efficient manner.

Â· Produce program materials such as Periodic Resident Newsletter.

Â· Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Â· Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication, listening, facilitation, problem solving, and decision making skills.

Â· Maintain professional boundaries, including exercising objectivity and confidentiality, while building trusting relationships with residents and staff.

Â· Basic computer proficiency, including ability to maintain data in an electronic database, communicate via e-mail, use internet and operate word processing software to create program materials.

Â· Cultural competency in working with diverse populations and individuals from different ethnic and racial backgrounds, including working with non-English speaking adults.

Â· Self-direct and work independently, but also function well as part of a team.

Â· Experience building relationships and partnerships with local service providers, community institutions and government agencies.

Â· Understanding of affordable housing operations and fair housing practices.

Â· Respect for and comfort with allowing individuals to make their own decisions and prioritize their own care goals.

Â· Ability to multi-task and establish priorities in a sometimes busy and stressful environment.

Â 

Education and Qualifications:

Â· Bachelorâ€™s degree in Social Work, Sociology, Psychology, Gerontology, or related field or equivalent experience.

Â· Experience with or knowledge of HUD regulatory requirements is plus.

Â· Excellent written and oral communication required. Additional ability to speak other languages such as Cantonese, Mandarin, Spanish or Farsi is a plus. Note: Some properties require fluency in specific languages.

Â· Basic computer skills including ability to navigate the internet, use Outlook, create Word and Excel documents, and work with a web-based database.

Â· Must complete annual online training through learning management system and offsite in-person trainings as required.

Â· CA Driver License requiredâ€”driving to various sites is required

Â 

Work Environment and Physical and Mental Requirements, and Other Requirements:

Â· The work environment and characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The work environment is an office environment, community meeting room, or a residentâ€™s apartment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

The employee is often required to move continually throughout the work day; maintain dexterity to pinch small objects; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, climb, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Â· Able to drive 30% of the time to residentsâ€™ apartments throughout the region (mileage reimbursed at current federal rate). Able to tolerate possible exposure to fumes, dust and other environmental elements.

JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:

Summary: Reporting to the Charge Nurse, the Certified Nursing Assistant provides direct care to residents of the skilled nursing facility in accordance with standards of practice and regulatory requirements of the Department of Health Services.

Responsibilities

  • The Certified Nursing Assistant ensures quality nursing and wellness care to the residents in Skilled Nursing.
  • Assists in preparation of nursing unit, resident rooms, and beds

  • The Certified Nursing Assistant assists residents in the activities of daily living, including oral hygiene, nail care, transfers, and mobility.

  • Encourages residents to participate in activities
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant is responsible for maintaining order and safety in resident living areas.
  • Assures maximum functioning of resident through range of motion activities, toileting schedule, and the feeding and turning schedule
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant observes residents for any physical and behavioral changes and reports them to the charge nurse, and is a mandatory reporter for all suspected abuse situations.
  • Participates in all staff meetings, and other meetings as necessary
  • Records all pertinent information pertaining to the daily care of residents, including weights, activities of daily living, intake and output, and reports this information to charge nurse
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant observes and reports any needed repairs or service for building or equipment to charge nurse.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Ability to read, speak well and be understood clearly in the English language
  • Bilingual ability preferred

Education and Qualifications

  • Current California CNA certification
  • At least six months experience as a CNA in acute or long term care setting of written reference from CNA program instructor
  • Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification
  • High school diploma or equivalent

A coachable cook with at least a few years of experience, skilled with handling all manners of kitchen tools in a safe and efficient manner. You truly understand cooking concepts such as timing, heat application, tasting and seasoning, not just following a recipe. WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. The kitchen is spacious, but know that youâ€™ll be exposed to heat, grease, high energy and long hours on your feet.

Under the direction of the Executive Director, the Director of Human Resources provides service and support to all community employees and guidance and support to management and supervisory staff regarding human resources issues, including employee relations, policy interpretation, salary, wage and benefit administration, recruitment and selection, training, safety and workersâ€™ compensation. Demonstrates ability to interpret company policies and procedures and ensures managers and employees understand and adhere to them. This position has full responsibility for all HR functions in the community.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Â 

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

Â· Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

Â· Provides employee relations support to all community employees. Provides advice and counsel to managers and supervisors on employee-related concerns as per company work rules. Facilitates internal investigations following allegations of employee misconduct and maintains records of such investigations. Coordinates corrective actions taken, as per company and department policies.

Â· Facilitates the hiring process, adhering to the New Hire Check list, including recruitment advertising, job offers, reference checks, pre-employment drug, health & criminal record clearance, work authorization (I-9s) and work permits. Participates in interview and selection process for key community personnel, including administrative and leadership positions.

Â· Provides training in such areas as new employee orientation, supervisor training, safety training, and mandated Federal, State, and company compliance training. Coordinates department-specific and ongoing training with department managers/supervisors.

Â· Administers employee benefit plans for Health, Dental, Vision, Life/ADD, and LTD plans, including COBRA administration. Maintains record of insurance coverage, and processes monthly invoices to balance with company and employee-paid premiums.

Â· Manages Injury and Illness Prevention Program. Investigates accidents and prepares reports for insurance carrier. Manages workers compensation claims, return to work/transitional duty program in accordance with company policy. Facilitates monthly IIPP meetings, participates in and/or leads safety committee creating a safety culture within the community.

Â· Approves and processes employee separations, including exit interviews. Identifies turnover trends and reacts accordingly with community leadership team. Represents community at unemployment hearings.

Â· Manages employee evaluation/Pay for Performance process. Prepares and processes wage and status changes, coordinating with department managers and supervisors, Executive Director, and Home Office HR team. Participates in local wage surveys, ensuring competitive pay and benefit ranges are in place.

Â· Manages and/or completes bi-weekly payroll processing, including employee timekeeping, commissions, and bonus payments. Ensures compliance with all wage and hour laws. Works with department leadership and Executive Director to manage overtime and other payroll issues.

Â· May act as community Point Person for Service Excellence program, working with SEAs to plan and schedule workshops and other program meetings.

Â· Manages employee recognition programs, including Employee of the Month, safety, all-staff meetings, employee parties and other appreciation events to promote increased retention.

Â· Serves as part of community leadership, participating in interdisciplinary teams such as resident assessment council, director on duty, marketing/occupancy efforts and social accountability.

Â· Supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws including interviewing, hiring and training employees, planning, assigning and directing work, appraising performance, rewarding and disciplining employees, addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Â· Follows all federal, state and company policies, health codes and guidelines.

Â· Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures and governmental regulations; ability to write reports and business correspondence; ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public.

JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:

Summary:

The Server is responsible for serving residents and guests in the main dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and in the personal care dining room. Â· Serves residents and their guests in the Dining Room, and is responsible for properly charging each account for food and beverages served.

Â· Sets up, serves and takes down all breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets.

Â· Considers placement of foods to create an attractive display that is convenient for residents.

Â· Maintains the cleanliness of the areas, and assures dish ware and/or utensils are supplied as needed.

Â· Performs side duties as assigned, including preparing the dining room for service and maintaining the cleanliness of the dining room, the wait stations, tea room, and private rooms after catered events, and related kitchen areas.

Â· Takes messages and forwards to the appropriate people.

Â· Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; and if an emergency or disaster occurs, immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties.

Â· Performs other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Assistant Director of Dining Services, Executive Chef and the Director of Dinning Services.

Â· English proficiency.

Â· Experience or aptitude for working with senior citizens preferred.

Â· Must be customer-oriented and possess good communication skills.

Â· Able to follow both written and verbal instructions and relate to older people.

Â· Able to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately.

Â· Able to form cooperative, effective, productive working relationships.

    Â· Able to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops.

    . Able to communicate with other dining room personnel and production staff.

    . Able to interact with residents and coworkers in a respectful manner.

    Â· Must be willing and able to communicate openly with management.

    Â· Knowledge or aptitude for the safe use of rolling carts, serving trays, tray jack stand, pen, order tickets, POS system, commercial coffee and juice machines, telephone, elevators.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS FOR A CAREGIVER / DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

  • Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

  • Assists the residents to and from the dining room, and assists in serving meals. Serves trays to residents in their rooms, if necessary, and assists with cutting of food.
  • Assists residents with bathing, dressing and personal hygiene.
  • Washes residentâ€™s personal laundry as needed. Makes residentâ€™s beds daily.
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary environment.
  • Maintains log with all vital information.
  • Reports to Supervisor regularly regarding the resident's condition.
  • Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.

- competitive wages,

- employer paid life insurance,

JobPostingExport.Description: Field Project Coordinator - Center of Innovation &
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Walnut Creek Office

The Front Porch Center for Innovation and Wellbeing (FPCIW;Â www.fpciw.org) explores the innovative uses of technology to empower individuals to thrive, particularly as we age. FPCIW works collaboratively with all stakeholders and in partnership with community members/residents, funding sources, researchers, and technology partners. This Field Project Coordinator (FPC) will primarily support and implement activities for the Center at our northern California Bay Area communities.Â This is a full time hourly position that will start immediately.

The FPC will report to and work closely with the FPCIW vice president to oversee pilot and grant initiatives. This position oversees project development and management, training activities, and volunteer management with an emphasis on direct community engagement and involvement. The FPC also coordinates equipment and technology implementation, supports on-site training associated with this equipment, and serves as a community-resource or a â€œsuper userâ€ of technology-enabled health and wellness applications.

The candidate must be highly independent, demonstrate the capacity to work with little supervision in a fast-paced environment. The candidate will be based out of our Walnut Creek office, and also be able to work comfortably under mobile and telecommuting conditions from home and communities on site.

A valid California Driverâ€™s License, access to an insured vehicle, and ability to frequently travel to and from local community sites participating in projects are required. The position requires an average of 30-60% local travel, and may also include some air travel and overnight stays.

Essential duties and responsibilities:

  • Independently organize training opportunities for various community stakeholders.
  • Develop curriculum and lesson plans relevant to project activities.
  • Support the coordination of equipment installation at community project locations, including on-site training, purchasing, and equipment deployment; serve as a resource for â€œad hocâ€ training necessary throughout the project.
  • Develop and execute project plans that include:

    1. Research and project justification
    2. The design and implementation of outreach strategies to recruit community participants (including staff members);
    3. Training and adoption; and
    4. Project evaluation

    • Ensure the achievement and success of project milestones.
    • Recruit and manage volunteers to support project activities.
    • Develop and oversee data collection and analysis for project evaluation.
    • Produce progress reports, presentations, or other materials, and ensure they are promptly submitted.
    • Maintain appropriate relations with vendors to ensure adherence to project plans.
    • Provide facilitation and other community engagement activities to support the transition within the communities to technology-enabled health and wellness.
    • Provide a leadership or supportive role in the design and implementation of team-based activities, projects and events.
    • Support other team member projects on an as-needed basis.
    • Promote positive and fun working relationships with fellow team members, community collaborators, and business partners.

    Qualifications:

    • Bachelorâ€™s degree; Masters or post-college degree desirable.
    • Prior experience working in a community collaborative or related project.
    • 2+ years of project coordination and management experience.
    • Excellent interpersonal and oral communication skills; ability to verbally express ideas assertively, clearly.
    • Ability to teach technology to community members and colleagues with diverse backgrounds and technology proficiencies.
    • Project management and leadership skills necessary to design, implement and monitor complex, multiple and multi- dimensional projects with a high attention to detail.
    • Excellent written communication skills required to prepare reports, project plans, and presentations.
    • Ability to develop strategic direction and parcel objectives into short-term tasks.
    • Excellent organizational skills and ability to work effectively and independently under pressure with minimal direction.
    • Ability to exercise tact and diplomacy in dealing with others to secure necessary information and cooperation from a variety of stakeholders.
    • Well-rounded technology skills in using desktop computers, laptops, the Internet, and mobile devices with a strong interest in understanding and using technology to support health, wellness, and engagement.Â Â

Spring Lake Village

Summary:

The Server I is responsible for serving residents and guests in the main dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and in the personal care dining room. Serves residents in private parties, setting up and serving catered parties, cleaning up the dining room, and any other meal service rooms as needed. Assigns proper charges to residents for guest meals, wine served, or any other miscellaneous charges not included in the monthly fees. It is required that this position be in full compliance with HIPAA.

Responsibilities:

  • Serves food and beverages to residents and guests in the dining room, in the personal care dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and other areas where food is served.
  • Provides professional and courteous service using correct service techniques.
  • Takes resident and guest food orders and carries food to table using waiter trays.
  • Sets up and serves catered parties and coffee breaks as assigned. Breaks down and cleans up after catered parties.
  • Serves residents and their guests in the Dining Room, and is responsible for properly charging each account for food and beverages served.
  • Sets up, serves and takes down all breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets.
  • Considers placement of foods to create an attractive display that is convenient for residents.
  • Maintains the cleanliness of the areas, and assures dish ware and/or utensils are supplied as needed.
  • Performs side duties as assigned, including preparing the dining room for service and maintaining the cleanliness of the dining room, the wait stations, tea room, and private rooms after catered events, and related kitchen areas.
  • Attends and participates in menu meetings and monthly in-service meetings as scheduled.
  • Employee must be able to work well under pressure; meeting multiple and sometimes competing deadlines. Employee must at all times demonstrate cooperative behavior with staff, colleagues, and supervisors.
  • Assists Host/Hostess with opening duties as assigned.
  • Answers phone calls in the dining room in the absence of the Host/Hostess, using proper language as instructed.
  • Takes messages and forwards to the appropriate people.
  • Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; and if an emergency or disaster occurs, immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties.
  • Performs other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Assistant Director of Dining Services, Executive Chef and the Director of Dinning Services.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • English proficiency.
  • Experience or aptitude for working with senior citizens preferred.
  • Must be customer-oriented and possess good communication skills.
  • Able to follow both written and verbal instructions and relate to older people.
  • Able to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately.
  • Able to form cooperative, effective, productive working relationships.
  • Able to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops.

Glendale, CA office

The Senior Director, Network Services provides mission critical leadership to Front Porch technical operations. Reporting to the VP of Technical Operations, this position is responsible for managing all network operations across multiple customer locations, 2 data centers and a team of 4 network engineers.Â 

What you'll be doing:Â 

â€¢ Provide technical leadership for a team of engineers and managers tasked with daily WAN / LAN operationsÂ 

â€¢ Manage and maintain Internet/MPLS/AVPN/SDWAN connections to multiple data centers using BGP with multiple peers and diverse routing paths and failover technologies

â€¢ Work with Network Engineers to determine network infrastructure requirements, including iSCSI storage networking, broadcast operation software requirements, and other critical business needsÂ 

â€¢ Work with Cisco, Fortinet, Velocloud and other networking/security technologies

â€¢ Assist with remote access for employees, ranging from client to appliance VPN configurations, Cisco AnyConnect and Citrix NetScaler VPNÂ 

â€¢ Monitor the network, storage, servers and applications using Nagios, ManageEngine and Microsoft monitoring solutions

â€¢ Travel to remote communities and data centers to deploy technologies, manage networks, perform projects and other tasks as required

â€¢ Provide tier 3 support to Network Team and Stakeholders as required on an on-call basis as part of a larger rotationÂ 

Required experience:Â 

â€¢ Technical staff management including ability to monitor performance against objectives, ensure customer service, manage team tickets/workload, and all communication

â€¢ Identify, evaluate, and deploy technical solutions to resolve business problemsÂ 

â€¢ Experience working with vendors to identify products and technologies, research options, report bugs, solve problems, and build long term relationshipsÂ 

â€¢ Proven project management skills including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, manage scope, monitor performance against objectives, develop WBS, identify stakeholders, manage collaboration, establish milestones and ensure timelines, identify dependencies, monitor work in progress, host kickoff and weekly project meetings, develop agendas, manage meeting minutes, allocate resources effectively, monitor and mitigate risks, track issues, ensure QC and QA against defined metricsÂ 

â€¢ Ensure reliable and trustworthy networks by planning and carrying out routine maintenance and upgrades and assuring security standards are being met on the overall network and customer environmentsÂ 

Qualifications: Minimum 5 to 7 yearsâ€™ experience with:Â 

â€¢ multiple platforms and technologies including VMware. Windows Server, Linux, virtualization, applications and databases

â€¢ configuring, deploying and supporting storage, backup and related solutions including HPE, Pure, Veeam and othersÂ 

â€¢ maintaining and configuring Fortinet and Cisco solutions including, routing, switching, firewalls and wireless

â€¢ supporting WAN solutions including MPLS and SDWANÂ 

â€¢ telephony technologies including PRI, SIP, VOIP, PSTN, POTS, LTEÂ 

â€¢ web content gateways, anti-spam/anti-phishing, Anti-Virus/EDR, patch management, VPNâ€™s, DLP, CASB, and other security solutions and technologies

â€¢ VDI solutions such as VMware Horizon, Citrix, Azure Windows Virtual DesktopÂ 

â€¢ Extensive experience with Microsoft ecosystem (Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DFS, DHCP, Exchange, SQL, SharePoint, SCOM, SCCM, Azure, ADFS, Azure Connect, O365Â 

â€¢ Excellent time as well as people management and organizational skillsÂ 

â€¢ Track record with mentoring, coaching and developing employeesÂ 

â€¢ Excellent verbal communication, presentation and writing skillsÂ 

â€¢ Excellent diagnostic and problem-solving skillsÂ 

â€¢ Strong multi-vendor cloud experienceÂ 

Background:Â 

â€¢ A Bachelorâ€™s degree in related field is preferred

â€¢ ITIL change management processes and methodologyÂ 

â€¢ Solid understanding of security frameworks and privacy laws and regulations such as NIST CSR, CMM, SOC2, COBIT, ISO 27001, ISO 27002, HIPAA, HITECH, CCPA and othersÂ

Wesley Palms

Under the direction of the Executive Director/Administrator the Director of Health Services is responsible for the health and wellness needs of all Residential and Assisted Living residents. Implements policies, procedures and management systems. Coordinates nursing services with care centers, physicians, families, residents, consultants, ancillary service providers and other department personnel within the facility. Promotes quality care delivery by all providers.

Â ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Â Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

Â· Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

Â· Assures facility compliance with RCFE regulations in health related matters.

Â· Implements organizational policy and procedures.

Â· Recruits, hires, schedules, supervises, counsels, evaluates all nursing service employees in Residential Living and Summer House according to established policies and procedures.

Â· Conducts all trainings emphasizing the importance of safety in the work place and proper safety procedures.

Â· Ensures 24-hour provision of nursing services within Residential Living and Summer House.

Â· Acts as liaison between family, residents, and physicians.

Â· Supervises the health care services and programs to residents.

Â· Supervises computerized medical records process.

Â· Coordinates resident admissions and transfers with other departments and/or community agencies.

Â· Supervises and participates in resident interdisciplinary care plan conferences. Supervises documentation in resident health records and reviews scheduled audits.

Â· Participates in budget planning and monitoring of fee scheduling and charging for services and cost effective utilization of resources.

Â· Responsible for orientation and ongoing in-service education of all assisted living nursing staff.

Â· Promotes stimulation, uplifting and comfortable environments for residents, families and staff.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Â· Current LVN licensure required. Current RN licensure preferred; Experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable; 5 yearsâ€™ experience working in a senior community and have supervisory experience..

Â· Ability to read, analyze and interpret professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English.

Â· Basic mathematical skills required.

    Â· Must be able to understand, follow, support and initiate policies and procedures of the facility. Must be able to recognize emergency situations and respond appropriately; must be able to plan, organize, prioritize and implement work assignments efficiently; must be able to function effectively with no supervision.

Summary:

The Resident Services Coordinator (RSC) is responsible for assessing and identifying resident needs that focuses on housing success. The RSC will work in a proactive manner to link elderly, people with disabilities and low-income families to supportive services and other community resources. This position must be in full compliance with HIPPA.

Â 

Responsibilities:

Â· Provide non-clinical case management and referral services to all resident site (s), which includes securing the full range of social services as needed by individual residents.

Â· Assess and identify resident needs, develop and implement individual healthy aging plans, actively motivate and educate residents on self-management of chronic conditions, and in close collaboration with hospitals and nursing homes.

Â· Conduct initial assessment within 30 days of moved-in and update assessment including update Intake, Individual, ADL annually or as needed on ADL.

Â· Utilize and maintain accurate and timely documentation through AASC On-Line. Conduct initial resident assessment within 30 days of move in. Update assessment as needed. Submission of weekly report to housing administrator and supervisor.

Â· Organize and coordinate on-site wellness and health improvement programs, events and activities. Educate residents on wellness programs such as service availability, benefits, fall prevention, chronic diseases or tools for healthy living.

Â· Produce weekly report and timely submit to Housing Administrator, immediate supervisor, and contractorâ€™s request and HUD annual SfS (Standards for Success) Report.

Â· Conduct outreach and engagement, monitoring service periodically, home visits when needed.

Â· Work closely with Activities Coordinator (if applicable) to develop a wide range of activities within and outside the site, designed to build community and provide opportunities for socialization and wellness that is mutually beneficial to residents.

Â· Create with volunteer to establish volunteer support programs[SA1].

Â· Collaborate and sustain constructive relationships with residents and their families, service providers, organization staff, especially those in property management[SA2].

Â· Maintain accurately and timely documentation on all resident demographics, issues, requests, incidents, interactions and outcomes through online software (AASC Online).

Â· Maintain updated residentsâ€™ files and resources directory through online software (AASC Online).

Â· Attend staff meeting and Resident Services Coordinator on-going training and/or conference.

Â· Assist residents in identifying and accessing needed services and benefits, and serve as a liaison or advocate for residents when help is needed to secure resources.

Â· Maintain resident confidentiality with the resident population according to set guidelines. Report incidents of abuse and neglect to Adult and Child Protective Services as required by law.

Â· Establish informal and formal partnerships with health and supportive service agencies in the community to ensure that services are available and delivered in a timely and efficient manner.

Â· Produce program materials such as Periodic Resident Newsletter.

Â· Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Â· Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication, listening, facilitation, problem solving, and decision making skills.

Â· Maintain professional boundaries, including exercising objectivity and confidentiality, while building trusting relationships with residents and staff.

Â· Basic computer proficiency, including ability to maintain data in an electronic database, communicate via e-mail, use internet and operate word processing software to create program materials.

Â· Cultural competency in working with diverse populations and individuals from different ethnic and racial backgrounds, including working with non-English speaking adults.

Â· Self-direct and work independently, but also function well as part of a team.

Â· Experience building relationships and partnerships with local service providers, community institutions and government agencies.

Â· Understanding of affordable housing operations and fair housing practices.

Â· Respect for and comfort with allowing individuals to make their own decisions and prioritize their own care goals.

Â· Ability to multi-task and establish priorities in a sometimes busy and stressful environment.

Â 

Education and Qualifications:

Â· Bachelorâ€™s degree in Gerontology, Psychology, Public Health, Social Work, Sociology, or related field or equivalent experience.

Â· Excellent written and oral communication requires. Additional ability to speak other languages such as Cantones, Mandarin, Spanish or Farsi is a plus. Note: Some properties require fluency in specific languages.

Â· Basic computer skills including ability to navigate the internet, use Outlook, create Word and Excel documents, and work with a web-based database.

Â· Must complete annual online training though learning management systems and offsite in-person training as required.

Â· Experience with or knowledge of HUD regulatory requirements is plus.

Summary:

The Server I is responsible for serving residents and guests in the main dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and in the personal care dining room. Serves residents in private parties, setting up and serving catered parties, cleaning up the dining room, and any other meal service rooms as needed. Assigns proper charges to residents for guest meals, wine served, or any other miscellaneous charges not included in the monthly fees. It is required that this position be in full compliance with HIPAA.

Â· Sets up, serves and takes down all breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets.

Â· Maintains the cleanliness of the areas, and assures dish ware and/or utensils are supplied as needed.

Â· Performs side duties as assigned, including preparing the dining room for service and maintaining the cleanliness of the dining room, the wait stations, tea room, and private rooms after catered events, and related kitchen areas.

Â· Answers phone calls in the dining room in the absence of the Host/Hostess, using proper language as instructed.

Â· Takes messages and forwards to the appropriate people.

Â· Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; and if an emergency or disaster occurs, immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties.

Â· Performs other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Assistant Director of Dining Services, Executive Chef and the Director of Dinning Services.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Â· Experience or aptitude for working with senior citizens preferred.

Â· Able to follow both written and verbal instructions and relate to older people.

Â· Able to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately.

Â· Able to form cooperative, effective, productive working relationships.

Â· Able to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops.

. Able to communicate with other dining room personnel and production staff.

. Able to interact with residents and coworkers in a respectful manner.

Â· Must be willing and able to communicate openly with management.

Â· Knowledge or aptitude for the safe use of rolling carts, serving trays, tray jack stand, pen, order tickets, POS system, commercial coffee and juice machines, telephone, elevators.

    Â· Previous experience in a food service or health care facility, restaurant or hotel.

Spring Lake Village

Summary:

The Server I is responsible for serving residents and guests in the main dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and in the personal care dining room. Serves residents in private parties, setting up and serving catered parties, cleaning up the dining room, and any other meal service rooms as needed. Assigns proper charges to residents for guest meals, wine served, or any other miscellaneous charges not included in the monthly fees. It is required that this position be in full compliance with HIPAA.

Responsibilities:

  • Serves food and beverages to residents and guests in the dining room, in the personal care dining room, resident apartments, private dining rooms, and other areas where food is served.
  • Provides professional and courteous service using correct service techniques.
  • Takes resident and guest food orders and carries food to table using waiter trays.
  • Sets up and serves catered parties and coffee breaks as assigned. Breaks down and cleans up after catered parties.
  • Serves residents and their guests in the Dining Room, and is responsible for properly charging each account for food and beverages served.
  • Sets up, serves and takes down all breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets.
  • Considers placement of foods to create an attractive display that is convenient for residents.
  • Maintains the cleanliness of the areas, and assures dish ware and/or utensils are supplied as needed.
  • Performs side duties as assigned, including preparing the dining room for service and maintaining the cleanliness of the dining room, the wait stations, tea room, and private rooms after catered events, and related kitchen areas.
  • Attends and participates in menu meetings and monthly in-service meetings as scheduled.
  • Employee must be able to work well under pressure; meeting multiple and sometimes competing deadlines. Employee must at all times demonstrate cooperative behavior with staff, colleagues, and supervisors.
  • Assists Host/Hostess with opening duties as assigned.
  • Answers phone calls in the dining room in the absence of the Host/Hostess, using proper language as instructed.
  • Takes messages and forwards to the appropriate people.
  • Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; and if an emergency or disaster occurs, immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties.
  • Performs other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Assistant Director of Dining Services, Executive Chef and the Director of Dinning Services.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • English proficiency.
  • Experience or aptitude for working with senior citizens preferred.
  • Must be customer-oriented and possess good communication skills.
  • Able to follow both written and verbal instructions and relate to older people.
  • Able to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately.
  • Able to form cooperative, effective, productive working relationships.
  • Able to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops.

Casa de MaÃ±ana Retirement Community is all about heart. We love people who care, and we care for the people you love. Come see why the vibe at our community is unlike any place youâ€™ve ever worked at.

What separates us from working at a hospice or other senior living community? Our unique location and low acuity operation mean your day may be more relaxed, allowing you to work at your best while having time to form relationships and complete charting or training tasks. Weâ€™re sure you have great plans for your future, and this is the perfect place to build up your skills in resident care, customer service, medication administration and general nursing.

WHO WE WANT
An experienced nurse who can gracefully coordinate and perform resident health assessments and plan-of-care evaluations. Perform treatments, administer medication and other nursing interventions as indicated by the patient plan of care or as ordered by a physician. Maintains inventory of medical supplies, medications and all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations. A team-player who can step in to cover different stations and shifts will be instrumental in maintaining our spirit of collaboration and connection.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a positive mindset and possess a knack for making other people smile. Youâ€™re adaptable, open to change, and inspire creativity in others. You value human connections and take extra steps to build trust with people. You believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, and display good patience for those who need more encouragement.

WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. You may notice our residents warmly greeting you as they go about their day.

During work, you be will frequently be required to stand, walk, examine things, and clearly communicate. You must also be able to:

Regularly: lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts, exposed to moderate noise levels

Occasionally: lift and/or move above 50 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means. Exposed to fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; extreme cold, extreme heat, risk of electrical shock and vibration

Note that the work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

What separates us from working at a hospice or other senior living community? Our unique location and low acuity operation mean your day may be more relaxed, allowing you to work at your best while having time to form relationships and complete charting or training tasks. Weâ€™re sure you have great plans for your future, and this is the perfect place to build up your skills in resident care, customer service, medication administration and general nursing.

WHO WE WANT
An experienced nurse who can gracefully coordinate and perform resident health assessments and plan-of-care evaluations. Perform treatments, administer medication and other nursing interventions as indicated by the patient plan of care or as ordered by a physician. Maintains inventory of medical supplies, medications and all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations. A team-player who can step in to cover different stations and shifts will be instrumental in maintaining our spirit of collaboration and connection.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a positive mindset and possess a knack for making other people smile. Youâ€™re adaptable, open to change, and inspire creativity in others. You value human connections and take extra steps to build trust with people. You believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, and display good patience for those who need more encouragement.

WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. You may notice our residents warmly greeting you as they go about their day.

During work, you be will frequently be required to stand, walk, examine things, and clearly communicate. You must also be able to:

Regularly: lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts, exposed to moderate noise levels

Occasionally: lift and/or move above 50 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means. Exposed to fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; extreme cold, extreme heat, risk of electrical shock and vibration

Note that the work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

San Francisco Towers

The Server serves residents in dining room according to standards set by Dining Room Manager. Constructs, delivers and picks up trays from resident apartments. Provides excellent food service to residents and guests. Follows complete HACCP Program for food safety. It is required that this position be in full compliance with HIPAA.

Responsibilities

  • The Server II ensures dining room tables and buffets are set properly prior to the start of each service.
  • Completes all duties as detailed in the position analysis
  • Greets residents in a friendly, welcoming manner
  • The Server II supports the Dining Room Host in greeting, seating, and serving residents.
  • Follows sanitation guidelines set forth by managers and the safety team
  • Provides leadership in setting, serving, and clearing catering events
  • Dresses in a neat, clean uniform, and practices good personal hygiene habits
  • Helps maintain high standards of service throughout the facility
  • The Server II will attend training sessions as assigned and complete other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Must be proficient in English
  • Ability to follow both written and verbal instructions
  • Ability to relate to older people
  • Ability to manage several tasks at one time efficiently and temperately
  • Ability to form cooperative, effective, and productive working relationships.
  • Ability to learn new tasks as the department grows and develops
  • Ability to communicate with other dining room personnel and production staff

Education and Qualifications

  • High School diploma or equivalent required
  • Previous experience in a food service or health care facility, restaurant, or hotel

Ruth's Table, Bethany Center, San Francisco, CA

Ruthâ€™s Table (RT) is an arts nonprofit program and gallery space committed to increasing access to creative opportunities for older adults and adults with disabilities, providing an inclusive environment for creative expression and intergenerational dialogue. RT offers a dynamic combination of gallery exhibitions, workshops, and creative community initiatives. We are passionate about relationship building and deeply committed to fostering the powerful impacts of creativity.

RT is a community service of Front Porch. Front Porch is a nonprofit provider of housing and services. We create community. Itâ€™s at the heart of all we do. RT shares a physical site with Bethany Center, a Front Porch senior living community. The RT Director reports to the Senior Director of Creative Engagement.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collaboratively shape vision for inspiring, accessible, replicable programmingÂ 
  • Collaboratively set and achieve annual program goals
  • Oversee program and site operations, ensuring daily activities support org mission and program goals
  • Manage, plan and co-curate rotating exhibition program and related programmingÂ 
  • Supervise the program manager, including providing regular 1:1 supervision, team meetings, and professional development opportunities
  • Creatively source and implement local outreach opportunities
  • Strategically cultivate relationships with Bethany Center staff/residents, local organizations, and community members
  • Implement special projects to support program developmentÂ 
  • Create replicable program and communication materials
  • Continually seek opportunities to strengthen and/or expand the program and its impactÂ 
  • Meet with supervisor on a regular basis to discuss progress, issues, and future plansÂ 
  • Assist in prospecting funding and sponsorship opportunities
  • Assist with evaluating and reporting program impactÂ 
  • Contribute to the budgeting process as needed
  • Contribute to grant writing and reporting, and sponsorship proposals as neededÂ 
  • Other duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Our organizational values: Connect, Build Trust, Collaborate, Lead Responsibly, Inspire Creativity, Embrace Change

Connect

  • Excellent communication skills: written, verbal, public speaking, interpersonal, team development
  • Self-motivated, curious, goal-oriented, and caring individual that works well independently, while also being able to work collaboratively within a team and with community partners

Build Trust

  • Provide culturally competent services and work with a diverse set of individuals in an empathetic and non-judgmental manner

Collaborate

  • Talent for nurturing impactful community relationships to meet specific programmatic objectives
  • Values inclusive practices in collaboration and communication to support and further RTâ€™s mission

Lead Responsibility

  • Ability to play a leadership role in program development and growth
  • Demonstrated experience in successfully managing all aspects of program operations

Inspire Creativity

  • Must be creative and an innovative thinker with entrepreneurial drive to grow program impact
  • Have personal creative practice(s) that nurture you; we welcome how that might influence the program or working relationships

Embrace Change

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills in an environment with competing priorities
  • High degree of digital literacy: ability to adapt to new digital tools

EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS

  • 6+ years of managing staff and developing community-based programming
  • Experience managing arts-based programming a plus
  • Bi-lingual fluency either in Spanish, Cantonese or Mandarin is a plus
  • Ability to work full-time with some weekends and evenings as needed
  • Some travel may be required
  • Gallery environment involves both indoor and outdoor working conditions
  • Ability to lift up to 25 lbs

JOB SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Director of Health Services/charge nurse or designee, the Memory Care Assistant is responsible for providing a variety of services and resident care to protect, sustain and nurture residents by providing assistance with activities of daily living and meeting other needs as required.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Â Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

  • Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.
  • Recognizes and responds to resident needs.
  • Assists residents with daily activities such as; bathing, dressing, personal hygiene, mobility, incontinence care, changing of positions and transfers.
  • Washes residentâ€™s personal laundry as needed. Makes residentâ€™s beds daily, provides routine housekeeping.
  • May prepare and/or serve meals to residents.
  • Facilitate programs to engage memory care residents, promoting autonomy of residentâ€™s decision making.
  • Maintain a positive and homelike environment for residents while ensuring they feel safe and purposeful.
  • Maintains log with all vital information.
  • Reports to the Charge Nurse/Memory Care team mates regularly regarding the resident's condition.
  • Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.
  • Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Uses equipment correctly and safely in performing patient/resident care; reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.
  • Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required.   • Current experience and/or training as required by state regulations; experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative aide.
  • Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English in order to follow and assist in emergency situations.
  • Basic mathematical skills desirable.
  • Must be able to understand, follow, support and initiate policies and procedures of the facility. Must be able to recognize emergency situations and respond appropriately.
  • ServSafe or Equivalent Certification required.

Summary:

The Maintenance Technician II helps ensure the effective overall maintenance, operation and safety of the facility, including, but not limited to, plumbing, electrical, painting, minor carpentry and equipment repairs.

Responsibilities:

Â· The Maintenance Technician II assists in performing preventative maintenance and repairs on mechanical, plumbing and electrical facilities and equipment, and assists in performing minor electrical repairs to light ballasts, light switches, base plugs, fluorescent lamp lights, exit lights, shorts in wiring, and light bulbs.

If you're looking for a career that provides more than competitive salaries and wages, and more than great benefits, then consider an opportunity with Vista del Monte. You'll work for a company that recognizes it cannot meet its customers' needs without first meeting the needs of its employees.

Summary: Reporting to the Charge Nurse, the Certified Nursing Assistant provides direct care to residents of the skilled nursing facility in accordance with standards of practice and regulatory requirements of the Department of Health Services.

Responsibilities:

  • Practices quality nursing and wellness care to residents of Skilled Nursing
  • Supports the company mission and practices the philosophy, nursing objectives and standards of the Department of Health Services. Demonstrates professional demeanor, appearance and cooperative working relationships with other staff and supervisors
  • Assists in daily preparation of nursing unit, resident rooms and beds
  • Assists in and may accompany resident in the admission, transfer and discharge procedure; records resident inventory and labels residentsâ€™ personal property
  • Assists residents in the activities of daily living, including oral hygiene, nail care, transfers and mobility
  • Provides wheelchair transportation and assists in ambulation to residents as needed
  • Encourages residents to participate in activities
  • Maintains order and safety within resident living areas
  • Encourages maximum functioning of resident through Range of Motion (ROM) activities, toileting schedule, feeding and turning schedule
  • Reinforces training as outlined by therapy staff
  • Observes residents for any physical and behavioral changes in condition and reports to the charge nurse
  • Maintains consistent attendance and punctuality; follows policy and procedure for time off requests and sick leave
  • Mandatory reporter: Able to identify, understand and appropriately report suspected abuse situations
  • Maintains active CNA certification; participates in in-services provided by the Nursing Staff
  • Participates in all staff meetings
  • Records and reports to charge nurse all information pertaining to the daily care of residents, including weights, Activities of Daily Living (ADLs), Intake and Output (I & O)
  • Reports any accidents and unusual occurrences immediately to charge nurse
  • Follows all established safety procedures and precautions when operating equipment and reports any unsafe/hazardous conditions to charge nurse
  • Observes and reports any needed repairs or services for building or equipment to charge nurse
  • Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; immediately assumes pre-assigned duties in the event of an emergency or disaster
  • Other duties as assigned by charge nurse

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Understanding of and compliance with HIPAA standards of practice
  • Ability to read, speak well and be understood clearly in the English language
  • Bilingual ability

Education and Qualifications:

  • Current California CNA certification
  • At least 6 months experience as a CNA in acute or long-term care setting or written reference from CNA program instructor
  • Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment
  • Employment contingent upon fingerprint clearance from the Department of Justice

JOB SUMMARY

Under the direction of Director of Nursing Services, is responsible for the coordination, supervision and directing the work of the CNAs and LVN Charge Nurse(s). Ensures that resident needs are met according to Federal and State regulations and Company Policy.

Â 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Â 

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

Â· Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

Â· Responsible for reviewing referrals in the absence of admissions or the Director of Nursing.

Â· Coordinates and performs patient assessments and plan of care evaluations.

Â· Assists LVN and CNA staff with their duties as needed.

Â· Coordinates and performs needed treatments, medications or other nursing interventions as indicated by the patient plan of care or as ordered by the physician.

Â· Ensures all needed emergency measures are followed as per Care Center and company Policy and within standards of nursing practice.

Â· Maintains required documentation as per Federal, State and Company Policy.

Â· Maintains inventory of medical supplies and medications to meet patient needs. Ensures that all patient rights are protected.

Â· Arrives to work on time, in proper clean uniform, good personal hygiene and with nametag visible.

Â· Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all Federal, State and company policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

Â· Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

Â· Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Â· Current licensure by the California Board of Registered Nursing; experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable; knowledgeable in current State and Federal regulation.

Â· Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English.

Â· Basic mathematical skills required.

Â· Must be able to understand, follow, support and initiate policies and procedures of the facility. Must be able to recognize emergency situations and respond appropriately.

Â 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS and WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Â· Requires standing, walking, talking, listening, grasping, reaching, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, pushing and pulling.

Â· Must be able to wear gloves to guard against exposure to body fluids and cleaning agents.

Â· Regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move above 50 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means.

Â· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Â· Exposed to moisture in showers and in other procedures. Potential for exposure to body fluids and cleaning agents. Possible contact with needles and sharp objects.

Â· Noise level is usually moderate.

Summary:

The Maintenance Technician II helps ensure the effective overall maintenance, operation and safety of the facility, including, but not limited to, plumbing, electrical, painting, minor carpentry and equipment repairs.

Â·Assists in performing minor carpentry work.

Â·Assists in maintenance and repair of facility equipment including laundry, food service and nursing equipment.

Â·Regularly uses basic hand and power tools, such as hammers, saws, screwdrivers, wrenches, saber saws and hand drills and basic electrical inspection and electrical test equipment and tools.

Â·Assists with routine maintenance checks as scheduled; maintains log books as required.

Â·Observes conditions of facility and reports any problems noted to Maintenance Supervisor/Manager or Director of Facility Services.

Â·Assists in moving residents as needed.

Â·Performs pool, spa and fountain maintenance tasks such as cleaning; replacing filters; monitoring and maintaining proper chemical levels and water temperature.

Â·Assists with janitorial work as necessary, including mopping and extracting of water, etc.

Â·At all times demonstrates cooperative behavior with staff, colleagues and supervisors.

Â·Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; immediately assumes the pre-assigned emergency duties in the event of an emergency or disaster.

Â·Any other tasks as assigned by management


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Â·Possesses mechanical aptitude; able to learn and retain basic skills of the trade.

Â·Able to work well under pressure, meeting multiple and sometimes competing deadlines.

Â·Able to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.

Â·Able to establish effective working relationships with others throughout the facility.

Â· Able to read blueprints, diagrams, and operating/maintenance instructions.


Education and Qualifications:

Â·High School diploma or equivalent required.

Â· Trade or vocational school training preferred.

Â· Three or more yearsâ€™ experience in maintenance or construction, preferably performing electrical, plumbing, and mechanical trade duties.

Â·Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment.

Work Environment, Physical and Mental Capabilities, and Other Requirements:

Â·The work environment and characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The work environment is an office environment, community meeting room, or a residentâ€™s apartment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Â·While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to perform strenuous labor for extended periods of time and to stand, walk and sit intermittently; to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and to hear and speak with peers, residents, and others. The employee is often required to move continually throughout the work day; to work in all kinds of weather conditions. The employee is regularly required to maintain dexterity to pinch small objects; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, climb, crawl, and work in awkward or cramped positions or on ladders. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


Exposure Risk:

The Maintenance Technician II is at low risk for exposure to blood and body fluids.

JOB SUMMARY

Under the supervision of the Director of Dining Services or Executive Chef, a Dishwasher washes and cleans tableware, pots, pans and cooking equipment. Keeps the dish-room and equipment clean and organized by performing the following duties.

â€¢ Load, run and unload the dish machine.

â€¢ Clean and sanitize work areas, equipment, utensils, dishes, or silverware.

â€¢ Keep dish room clean and organized.

â€¢ Maintain adequate levels of clean tableware for dining room and kitchen.

â€¢ Bag and haul dish room trash to dumpster at designated times. Safely lift bags, cases and stacks.

â€¢ Handle tableware carefully to prevent breakage and loss.

â€¢ Maintain adequate levels of dish detergents and cleaning supplies.

â€¢ Clean food preparation and production areas as required.

â€¢ Be available to fill in as needed to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the kitchen as directed by the immediate supervisor.

â€¢ Works in a standing position and hot, wet, humid and loud environment for long periods of time.

â€¢ Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

â€¢ Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

â€¢ Follow department safety standards, practice correct body mechanic techniques and participate in campus-wide safety programs.

â€¢ Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

â€¢ Understand facilityâ€™s fire and disaster plans; follow established procedures during drills and actual emergencies.


JOB REQUIRMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS

â€¢ Ability to add and subtract 2-digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10's and 100's. Ability to perform these operations using units of American money and weight measurement, volume, and distance.

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out simple 1-2-step instructions. Ability to deal with standardized situations with only occasional variablesÂ
