    Summary: Shift RN

    The Staff Registered Nurse (RN) functions independently in performing nursing care through assessment, planning, intervention and evaluation of safe therapeutic care for patientsâ€™ overt and covert needs and/or complications of treatment during his or her assigned shift. Also leads and directs ancillary members of the health care team.

    Responsibilities:

    Â·Completes appropriate written history/assessment on residentsâ€™ clinical record within 4 hours of admission, including details from interviews with family, responsible parties and other nurses and physicians.

    Â·Legibly documents symptoms that indicate risk on the clinical record; incorporates nursing diagnostic data into written assessments.

    Â·Documents information from family, other nurses and physicians in the written assessment.

    Â·Prepares documents reflecting knowledge of expectations included in the Minimum Data Set (MDS); contributes in an appropriate and timely manner to the MDS.

    Â·Documents identified problems; develops and contributes to the care plan using nursing diagnosis; adds resident teaching needs and discharge planning to clinical records.

    Â·Uses resources and involves resident and/or family when formulating a written plan of care.

    Â·Incorporates the medical plan into the interdisciplinary plan for care.

    Â·Updates the Kardex and care plans using nursing diagnosis and outcome criteria.

    Â·Follows time frames when carrying out medical/nursing plan of care.

    Â·Communicates changes and responses to care in shift report.

    Â·Documents and sets priorities for care of residents based on need and resident preference.

    Â·Safely performs and documents nursing interventions required by the resident assignment and consistent with scientific principles and facility policy.

    Â·Carries out and documents medical and nursing care plans for residents; coordinates resident care activities with other members of the healthcare team.

    Â·Responds to information or data indicating acute risk to resident; initiates and documents action to reduce or correct the risk.

    Â·Explains tests, procedures and disease progression to resident and/or family. Instructing and informs resident or family of skills essential to understand and cope with illness and to promote optimal health or, if indicated, the discharge process; assesses and records family level of understanding on the clinical record.

    Â·Ensures that resident is reassessed as status requires. Documents resident response to care in clinical record.

    Â·Regularly evaluates effectiveness of nursing intervention per the intended goals; revises care plans accordingly.

    Â·Participates in resident care conferences.

    Â·Provides formal and informal teaching activities to promote staff education and knowledge.

    Â·Communicates identified learning needs of others to resources able to meet learnersâ€™ needs.

    Â·Assists in orientation of new staff; shares knowledge, experiences and acts as a preceptor or mentor. Assists others in choosing nursing intervention, developing skills and applying knowledge.

    Â·Assists in employee performance evaluation as needed.

    Â·Is knowledgeable of, follows and directs others to follow facility policies and department procedures and nursing unit protocols.

    Â·Administers medications safely and accurately, following existing department procedures.

    Â·Follows infection control policies, procedures and standard precautions.

    Â·Recognizes and communicates to proper authority any ethical and legal issues relative to patient care.

    Â·Completes notification forms according to protocol and notifies appropriate personnel.

    Â·Models prevention and safety principles for residents and staff. Uses mechanical equipment correctly and appropriately per the procedure manual. Detects faulty equipment and notifies appropriate person for repairs.

    Â·Supervises delegated care based on patient acuity and abilities or limitations of health care personnel.

    Â·Notes changing resident status that affects nursing unit staffing needs and adjusts assignments accordingly.

    Â·Responds cooperatively to immediate staffing and/or resident care needs; assists other staff when necessary and available.

    Â·Utilizes the steps of problems solving to resolve identified resident related problems. Acts as a staff resource to in problem identification and resolution.

    Â·Reports unit related problems using the supervisory communications structure.

    Â·Listens to and respects the ideas, opinions and feelings of others.

    Â·Completes clinical assignment in a timely fashion including maintenance of equipment and supplies necessary for the provision of resident care through the next shift.

    Â·Completes non-clinical assignments, tasks and projects within a pre-established agreed upon time frame.

    Â·Prioritizes own workload relative to resident care needs.

    Â·Participates in staff meetings; obtains information presented in staff meetings when unable to attend.

    Â·Participates in nursing unit goal-setting.

    Â·Attends all mandatory in-service programs and performs committee work as requested.

    Â·Performs other duties within capabilities as assigned by Supervisor.

    Â·Participates in setting measurable, individual professional goals; acquires knowledge and experience to meet goals; achieves change and growth based on evaluation and feedback

    Â·Treats all guests, resident contacts, employees and staff with respect and courtesy. Receives, places and transfers calls using appropriate telephone etiquette.

    Â·Handles information requests with courtesy, accuracy and respect for confidentiality.

    Â·Respects attendance, time-off and sick call policies. Arrives to work on time and prepared to start assignment.

    Â·Understands department and facility policies and procedures, as well as safety and security policies and performs to those standards.

    Â·Completes mandatory safety and security education.

    Â·Maintains Universal Precautions (Standard Precautions).

    Â·Attends annual fire/safety and hazardous materials review.

    Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

    Â·Understanding of and compliance with HIPAA standards of practice and the California Nurse Practice Act.

    Â·Utilize an Electronic Health Records system like Point Click Care (PCC)

    Â·Able to work patients from ages 55 to 120.

    Â·Able to work well with others and to perform a variety of assigned duties.

    Education and Other Qualifications:

    Â·Current license to practice as a Registered Nurse in the state of California.

    Â·One year of experience in either acute care or long-term care preferred.

    Â·Current CPR certification.

    Â·Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment.

Now offering a $3,000.00 sign on bonus!

Responsibilities include following the Plan of Care, providing treatments, and working collaboratively with the members of the team to help meet positive patient care outcomes.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

â€¢ Supervise CNA assignments.

â€¢ Provide nursing support, utilizing the nursing process to assess, plan, implement and evaluate patient care.

â€¢ Communicate results of laboratory and other diagnostic testing to the physician, and evaluating signs and symptoms. Indicating physiologic and psychosocial changes in the patientâ€™s condition.

â€¢ Ensure the care and safety of patients.

â€¢ Medication management.

â€¢ Wound Care.

â€¢ Executing physician orders.

â€¢ Other Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) duties as assigned by Supervisors.

â€¢ SCHEDULE: AM, PM, AND NOC SHIFTS/ROTATIONS AVAILABLE.

WHAT YOUâ€™LL BRING:

â€¢Compassion for the elderly and commitment to hospitality and service.

â€¢Positive and nurturing personality, a true want to help and care for those in need.

â€¢Team oriented and collaborative spirit.

â€¢Previous experience as an LVN required, long-term care industry experience a plus, but not necessary

â€¢We Love NEW GRADS! And experienced LVNS too!

â€¢Current LVN license in the state of CA required.

â€¢Current BLS certification required.


WHY YOU WANT TO WORK HERE:

  • Comprehensive benefits package to those who work 36+ hours a week
  • 403b retirement savings plan
  • Flexible health/dependent care plan
  • Opportunities for growth
  • Beautiful work environment
  • Friendly co workers

Casa de MaÃ±ana Retirement Community is all about heart. We love people who care, and we care for the people you love. Come see why the vibe at our community is unlike any place youâ€™ve ever worked at.

What separates us from working at a restaurant? Every customer is a regular. Get to know their stories and share their wisdom. If you made someone feel special on a Monday, youâ€™ll hear about it on Tuesday. Weâ€™re sure you have great plans for your future, and this is the perfect place to build up your skills in cooking, listening, communicating, and leading with care.

WHO WE WANT
We are looking for a Dietary Aide I who is passionate about providing quality customer service to our residents. The ideal candidate should be punctual, have good personal hygiene, and is always readily available to jump in to help with cleaning or other kitchen duties. They should be able to follow meal and snack schedules and assist the cook in preparing and serving meals. This person should have some experience with cutting fruits and vegetables, working on a cooking line or is highly interested in learning more about the culinary arts.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a positive mindset and possess a knack for making other people smile. Youâ€™re adaptable, open to change, and inspire creativity in others. You value human connections and take extra steps to build trust with people. You believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, and display good patience for those who need more encouragement.

WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. You may notice our residents warmly greeting you as they go about their day.

During work, you be will frequently be required to stand, walk, examine things, and clearly communicate. You must also be able to:

Regularly: lift and/or move up to 30 pounds, exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts, exposed to moderate noise levels

Occasionally: lift and/or move above 30 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means. Exposed to fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; extreme cold, extreme heat, risk of electrical shock and vibration

Job Summary:

Under the direction of the Chief Advancement Officer, with a dotted line to the CEO, this position is responsible to promote the Front Porch brand through integrated communications to internal and external audiences using all appropriate communications channels. This position collaborates with business line leaders throughout the corporation and with community leadership to provide planning, messaging and creative tactics on order to provide timely and relevant responses to issues and needs both within and outside the Front Porch Communities. Additionally, it is charged with developing and overseeing in-house and agency partners resources.


Essential Job Functions of Job Description:

1. Develop and implement a strategic integrated corporate communications plan that enhances Front Porchâ€™s visibility, increases mission and brand awareness, ensures message consistency, resonates with internal and external stakeholders in order to communicate the companyâ€™s priorities and build trust in the Front Porch brand.

2. Create a public relations strategy that will enable leadership to maintain and boost important relationships with targeted external audiences, including the media and influencers.

3. Serve as a representative and lead spokesperson on media interactions; work to secure good media coverage and a favorable Front Porch public image by formulating and maintaining proactive media relations plans.

  1. Work collaboratively throughout the organization to identify challenges and communication issues and propose effective short and long-term solutions.
  2. Train leadership throughout Front Porch on communication skills to recognize internal and external communications opportunities, provide a consistent message as well as solutions and define and execute suitable strategies to support them; thus, elevating the role of communications across the organization.

6. Ensure the Corporate Crisis Management Plan is constantly updated as well as managing the design, development and administration of all communications policies and procedures.

  1. Prioritize, optimize and oversee development of all corporate communications such as the website, employee newsletters, blog posts, impact reports and online communications on social media platforms.

8. Supervise the recruitment, training, and evaluation of department staff and training and evaluation of agency partners through coaching, counseling and providing feedback.

9. Perform all other related duties as assigned.

Physical Requirements:

1. The employee is regularly required to walk, sit, talk, hear and use hands in a normal manner. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and peripheral vision. Travel to communities is necessary.

Job Summary:

Under the direction of the Chief Advancement Officer, this position is responsible to provide strategic and tactical leadership in the achievement of sales and marketing activities for Front Porch. Through well planned and executed policies, programs, campaigns, and initiatives, this position leads the team to connect with prospective residents and achieve maximum sales volume, census and occupancy for market rate communities.Â

Direct and evolve the mythology for integrated marketing and sales plans to enhance Front Porch's occupancy, ensuring that the methodology and plans are aligns with Front Porch's overall business strategy.Â 

Assure that community sales and marketing teams are trained and held accountable to standards, metric, polices and procedures.

Supervise the recruitment, training, and evaluation of department staff and training and evaluation of agency partners through coaching, counseling and providing feedback.

Develop and manage a culture of engagement and hospitality throughout Front Porch by influencing and training all staff how to participate in marketing and sale, and contributing to initiatives that help to build trust and retain residents.Â 

Perform all other related duties as assigned.

Education and Experience:Â 

Bachelor's Degree in Communiations, Marketing, Business, Administration or related discipline coupled with a minimum of 8 years business experience in Marketing and Sales; including five years of supervisory experience required. Experience with marketing planning, sales strategy, training and data analytics also required.Â 

Strong time management, attention to detail and consistent follow-through skillsÂ 

Good analytical and critical thinking skills

Proficiency with Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, Power Point and WordÂ 

Effective communication skill, both verbal and written.

Â· Performs preventative maintenance procedures on mechanical equipment; inspects belts, check fluid levels, replace filters, greases bearings; repairs or replaces broken parts.

Â· Cleans and inspects boiler; treats water and proper chemicals.

Â· Skilled in using basic hand tools, hand held power tools, ladders, basic plumbing tools, drain cleaning machine, minor electrical, minor carpentry and painting.

Â· Maintains records of scheduled maintenance procedures.

Â· Performs other tasks within department; Housekeeping, Security, Refurbishment as needed.

Â· Wears PPE/safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

Â· Follows department safety standards, practice body mechanic techniques and participate in campus-wide safety programs.

Â· Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Â· High School diploma or general education degree (GED); or 1-3 months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Â· Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos; ability to write simple correspondence; ability to effectively present information in one-on-one situations to customers.

Â· Ability to add and subtract two digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10's and 100's. Ability to perform these operations using units of American money and weight measurement, volume, and distance.

Â· Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

Â 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS and WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Â· Frequently required to walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; talk or hear; and taste or smell.

Â· Occasionally required to stand; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.

Â· Must regularly lift and/or move up to 35 pounds, occasionally lift and/or move up to 65 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means.

Â· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

    Summary:

    Reporting to the Charge Nurse, the Certified Nursing Assistant provides direct care to residents of the skilled nursing facility in accordance with standards of practice and regulatory requirements of the Department of Health Services.

    Responsibilities:

    Â·Practices quality nursing and wellness care to residents of Skilled Nursing

    Â·Supports the company mission and practices the philosophy, nursing objectives and standards of the Department of Health Services. Demonstrates professional demeanor, appearance and cooperative working relationships with other staff and supervisors

    Â·Assists in daily preparation of nursing unit, resident rooms and beds

    Â·Assists in and may accompany resident in the admission, transfer and discharge procedure; records resident inventory and labels residentsâ€™ personal property

    Â·Assists residents in the activities of daily living, including oral hygiene, nail care, transfers and mobility

    Â·Provides wheelchair transportation and assists in ambulation to residents as needed

    Â·Encourages residents to participate in activities

    Â·Maintains order and safety within resident living areas

    Â·Encourages maximum functioning of resident through Range of Motion (ROM) activities, toileting schedule, feeding and turning schedule

    Â·Reinforces training as outlined by therapy staff

    Â·Observes residents for any physical and behavioral changes in condition and reports to the charge nurse

    Â·Maintains consistent attendance and punctuality; follows policy and procedure for time off requests and sick leave

    Â·Mandatory reporter: Able to identify, understand and appropriately report suspected abuse situations

    Â·Maintains active CNA certification; participates in in-services provided by the Nursing Staff

    Â·Participates in all staff meetings

    Â·Records and reports to charge nurse all information pertaining to the daily care of residents, including weights, Activities of Daily Living (ADLs), Intake and Output (I & O)

    Â·Reports any accidents and unusual occurrences immediately to charge nurse

    Â·Follows all established safety procedures and precautions when operating equipment and reports any unsafe/hazardous conditions to charge nurse

    Â·Observes and reports any needed repairs or services for building or equipment to charge nurse

    Â·Participates in Facility Emergency Plan training and fire drills; immediately assumes pre-assigned duties in the event of an emergency or disaster

    Â·Other duties as assigned by charge nurse

    Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

    Â·Understanding of and compliance with HIPAA standards of practice

    Â·Ability to read, speak well and be understood clearly in the English language

    Â·Bilingual ability

    Education and Qualifications:

    Â·Current California CNA certification

    Â·At least 6 months experience as a CNA in acute or long-term care setting or written reference from CNA program instructor

    Â·Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification

    Â·High school diploma or equivalent

    Â·Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment

JobPostingExport.Description: Director of Spiritual Services - part-time- Canter
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Canterbury Woods, Pacific Grove, CA
This is a part-time non-exempt position, 24 hours per week.

Canterbury Woods has been designated a Great Place to Work for the last few years.

Come join our amazing team at Canterbury Woods!

The Director of Spiritual Services promotes the spiritual, emotional, and attitudinal health of residents, families, staff, and others as needed at the community.Â 

Responsibilities:

Â· Performs a pastoral ministry to residents, patients and their families, enabling them to utilize their resources of emotional health and faith (ideas, beliefs, feelings, values, history, prayers, and rituals) as motivating forces for life and health to affirm meaning and growth

Â· Makes regularly scheduled rounds in the Assisted Living and Skilled Nursing units

Â· Visits as needed to Independent Living residents in their apartments or in hospital Â· Present programs to aid families, resident, patients in adjusting to the changes in their lives

Â· Leads worship experiences, growth groups, prayer groups, Bible study and other religious programs as needed in the Chapel and in Skilled Nursing unit

Â· Develops a bereavement follow-up program with families

Â· Performs a pastoral ministry of consultation, counseling, education, training, and support to staff so they are better able to employ their personal, emotional, and spiritual resources to their work

Â· Acts as a consultative/educational resource to the religious community so that pastors, priests, rabbis, and lay people may improve their ministry skills to those who are ill, under stress or undergoing life changes

Â· Develops orientation and training programs for church groups and visiting clergy ministering in the community

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Â· Knowledge of various faiths, religious doctrines, principles and practices of the faith practiced

Â· Ability to organize a program of religious service and devise and instruct religious education programs

Â· Must be able to function independently, have personal integrity, flexibility, and to work effectively with residents, staff, guest, visitors, and support agencies

Education and Other Qualifications:

    Â· Holds a degree from an undergraduate college or university as well as a degree from a school of theology (M. Div. preferred); at least one unit of Clinical Pastoral Education; holds denominational endorsement for ministry and is in good standing with denomination; certification by national chaplaincy organization or association preferred; pastoral experience with older adults preferred.Â 

    Â Â·Two years prior experience in a chaplaincy, working with seniors preferred

Casa de MaÃ±ana Retirement Community is all about heart. We love people who care, and we care for the people you love. Come see why the vibe at our community is unlike any place youâ€™ve ever worked at.

What separates us from working at a restaurant? Every customer is a regular. Get to know their stories and share their wisdom. If you made someone feel special on a Monday, youâ€™ll hear about it on Tuesday. Weâ€™re sure you have great plans for your future, and this is the perfect place to build up your skills in customer service, listening, communicating, and leading with care.

WHO WE WANT
We're looking for friendly and efficient servers to join our team at Front Porch. As a Server, you'll interact with our residents and ensure they have a great dining experience. You'll be responsible for providing quality customer service, preparing tables, presenting menus, suggesting dishes, and fulfilling guest needs.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a positive mindset and possess a knack for making other people smile. Youâ€™re adaptable, open to change, and inspire creativity in others. You value human connections and take extra steps to build trust with people. You believe that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, and display good patience for those who need more encouragement.

WHAT THE ENVIRONMENT IS LIKE
You will see the Pacific Ocean every day you drive into work. You can have lunch on a bench close to the beach. You may notice our residents warmly greeting you as they go about their day.

During work, you be will frequently be required to stand, walk, examine things, and clearly communicate. You must also be able to:

Regularly: lift and/or move up to 40 pounds, exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts, exposed to moderate noise levels

Occasionally: lift and/or move above 40 pounds with the assistance from a co-worker and/or mechanical means. Exposed to fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; extreme cold, extreme heat, risk of electrical shock and vibration

Note that the work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Summary:

The Administrator is responsible for the efficient and safe management of the residential property and community operations consistent with established standards and practices. This individual supervises several direct reports, and directs personnel and resources to ensure that the community is maintained in the best possible physical condition within the limits of the established budget.Â 

Responsibilities:

Â· Provides general administration for the community and its programs.

Â· Supervises day-to-day operations and community employees including several direct reports.

Â· Ensures that all services provided meet established quality standards and federal and state regulations.

Â· Manages the annual operating and capital budget including monthly review of financial reports.

Â· Manages occupancy functions including income certification, rent calculation, rent and deposit collection, delinquency reports, and related functions in accordance with HUD and Fair Housing requirements.

Â· Manages waiting lists, marketing of units, move-ins, move-outs and unit turns in accordance with Fair Housing and HUD occupancy standards.

Â· Trains, evaluates and counsels AH community employees in accordance with established Human Resource policies and procedures.

Â· Human Resource functions include hiring and terminations of employees in coordination with Executive Management and Human Resources.

Â· Develops positive working relationships with employees, residents, residentsâ€™ families, community service organizations; volunteers and Support Services staff, and HUD personnel. At certain communities interacts with DSS staff and Ombudsman.

Â· May develop maintenance work schedules; coordinate maintenance work orders, and oversee preventative maintenance programs.

Â· Submits accurate time and payroll records; accounts receivable and accounts payable documentation.

Â· Achieves score of above average on HUD Management and Occupancy reviews and a score of 80 or above on REAC inspections.

Â· At certain communities ensures compliance with all Dept. of Social Services regulations (Title 22) as necessary.

    Â· Other duties as necessary or assigned.

    Education and Other Qualifications:

    Â· Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent experience. Masterâ€™s Degree in gerontology, business, or social services preferred. At certain communities a current Administrator Certification for Residential Care Facility for the Elderly (RCFE) is required.

    Â· Possession of a Certified Occupancy Specialist Certification and LIHTC (tax credit) is desirable.

    Â· Must complete and pass a physical examination with tuberculosis (TB) screen prior to employment.

      Â· Employment contingent upon fingerprint clearance from the Department ofÂ Justice.

Under the supervision of the Director of Dining Services or Executive Chef, a Dishwasher washes and cleans tableware, pots, pans and cooking equipment. Keeps the dish-room and equipment clean and organized by performing the following duties.

JobPostingExport.Description: Director of Nursing II Sign on Bonus
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Claremont Manor

Under the direction of the Executive Director/Administrator the Director of Nursing is responsible for the health and wellness needs. Implements policies, procedures and management systems. Coordinates nursing services with care centers, physicians, families, residents, consultants, ancillary service providers and other department personnel within the facility. Promotes quality care delivery by all providers.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.
  • Assures facility compliance with title 22 in health-related matters.
  • Implements organizational policy and procedures.
  • Recruits, hires, schedules, supervises, counsels, evaluates all nursing service employees in Summer House according to established policies and procedures.
  • Conducts all trainings emphasizing the importance of safety in the workplace and proper safety procedures.
  • Ensures 24-hour provision of nursing services within Residential Living and Summer House.
  • Acts as liaison between family, residents, and physicians.
  • Supervises the health care services and programs to residents.
  • Supervises computerized medical records process.
  • Coordinates resident admissions and transfers with other departments and/or community agencies.
  • Supervises and participates in resident interdisciplinary care plan conferences. Supervises documentation in resident health records and reviews scheduled audits.
  • Participates in budget planning and monitoring of fee scheduling and charging for services and cost-effective utilization of resources.
  • Responsible for orientation and ongoing in-service education of all assisted living nursing staff.
  • Promotes stimulation, uplifting and comfortable environments for residents, families and staff.

EDUCATION OR EXPERIENCE

  • Current RN licensure required. Experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable; 5 yearsâ€™ experience working in a senior community and have supervisory experience.
  • We offer a comprehensive benefits package and paid time off.
  • Final candidates must successfully complete a pre-employment physical, physical abilities test, drug screen and Department of Justice Criminal background clearance.

JobPostingExport.Description: Program Director - Art Gallery at Carlsbad By The
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Front Porch Art GalleryÂ shares a physical site with Carlsbad by the Sea, a Front Porch community.

Front Porch Gallery (FPG) is a nonprofit arts program and gallery space committed to increasing access to creative opportunities for older adults and adults with disabilities, providing an inclusive environment for creative expression and intergenerational dialogue. FPG offers a dynamic combination of gallery exhibitions, workshops, and creative community initiatives. We are passionate about relationship building and deeply committed to fostering the powerful impacts of creativity.

FPG is a community service of Front Porch, a nonprofit provider of housing and services. We create community. Itâ€™s at the heart of all we do. FPG shares a physical site with Carlsbad by the Sea, (CBTS) a Front Porch community.

The FPG Director reports to the Senior Director of Creative Engagement.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaboratively shape vision for inspiring, accessible, replicable programming
  • Collaboratively set and achieve annual program goals
  • Oversee program and site operations, ensuring daily activities support the organizationâ€™s mission and program goals
  • Manage, plan and co-curate a rotating exhibition program and related programming
  • Supervise gallery associates, including providing regular 1:1 supervision, team meetings, and professional development opportunities
  • Creatively source and implement local outreach opportunities
  • Create replicable program and communication materials
  • Manage all marketing activities: advertising, video, social media, direct mail, website
  • Strategically cultivate relationships with CBTS staff/residents, local organizations, and community members
  • Implement special projects to support program development
  • Continually seek opportunities to strengthen and/or expand the program and its impact
  • Meet with supervisor on a regular basis to discuss progress, issues, and future plans
  • Complete all administrative work, employment requirements, and reporting
  • Assist with evaluating and reporting program impact
  • Contribute to the budgeting process as needed
  • Contribute to grant and sponsorship activities as needed
  • Other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

  • Our organizational values: Connect, Build Trust, Collaborate, Lead Responsibly, Inspire Creativity, Embrace Change

Connect

  • Excellent communication skills: written, verbal, public speaking, interpersonal, team development
  • Self-motivated, curious, goal-oriented, and caring individual that works well independently, while also being able to work collaboratively within a team and with community partners
  • Desire to interact through meaningful relationships with older people

Build Trust

  • Provide culturally competent services and work with a diverse set of individuals in an empathetic and non-judgmental manner

Collaborate

  • Talent for nurturing impactful community relationships to meet specific programmatic objectives
  • Values inclusive practices in collaboration and communication to support and further RTâ€™s mission

Lead Responsibly

  • Ability to play a leadership role in program development and growth
  • Demonstrated experience in successfully managing all aspects of program operations

Inspire Creativity

  • Must be creative and an innovative thinker with entrepreneurial drive to grow program impact
  • Have personal creative practice(s) that nurture you; we welcome how that might influence the program or working relationships

Embrace Change

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills in an environment with competing priorities
  • High degree of digital literacy: ability to adapt to new digital tools

Experience Requirements

  • 6+ years of managing staff and developing community-based programming
  • Experience managing arts-based programming
  • Ability to pass a Live Scan fingerprint background check (which FPG pays for), exam, TB test, and drug screening.
  • Ability to work full-time with some weekends and evenings as needed
  • Some travel may be required
  • Gallery environment involves both indoor and outdoor working conditions
  • Ability to lift up to 25 lbs.

    Front Porch is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We support all aspects of diversity and provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability or status as a veteran in accordance with the applicable nondiscrimination laws. Final candidates must successfully complete a pre-employment physical, physical abilities test, drug screen and Department of Justice Criminal background clearance.

JOB SUMMARY

Receives callers at community/office, determines nature of business, and directs callers to destination by performing the following duties.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Â 

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

Â· Directs caller to destination and records name, time of call, nature of business, and person called upon.

Â· Takes messages accurately including correct spelling of names and phone number.

Â· Operates multi-line telephone console to receive incoming messages.

Â· Greet incoming visitors, screen visitors in lobby if unfamiliar.

Â· Proficiency with multi-line telephones, telephone head set, calculator, fax machine, postal machine and copy machine.

Â· May cash checks; sell stamps, bill residents for meal charges by entering data on computer system.

Â· May sell meal tickets to employees and issues visitors pass when required.

Â· May make guest room reservations.

    Under the direction of Director of Nursing Services, is responsible for the coordination, supervision and directing the work of the CNAs and LVN Charge Nurse(s). Ensures that resident needs are met according to Federal and State regulations and Company Policy.

    ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

    Includes the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

    Responsible for reviewing referrals in the absence of admissions or the Director of Nursing.

    Coordinates and performs patient assessments and plan of care evaluations.

    Assists LVN and CNA staff with their duties as needed.

    Coordinates and performs needed treatments, medications or other nursing interventions as indicated by the patient plan of care or as ordered by the physician.

    Ensures all needed emergency measures are followed as per Care Center and company Policy and within standards of nursing practice.

    Maintains required documentation as per Federal, State and Company Policy.

    Maintains inventory of medical supplies and medications to meet patient needs. Ensures that all patient rights are protected.

    Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all Federal, State and company policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

    Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

    EDUCATION OR EXPERIENCE

    Current licensure by the California Board of Registered Nursing; experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable; knowledgeable in current State and Federal regulation.

Claremont Manor Retirement Community is recruiting for a full time Food Service Aide for our Skilled Nursing Facility.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Tray Server employees interacts with our residents and employees of Front Porch residential facilities, and ensures they have a great experience when dining. Tray servers are responsible for positive guest interactions while serving in a friendly and efficient manner. At all times, tray servers are expected to be attentive to our guests needs and making them feel welcome, comfortable, important and relaxed. Tray servers are expected to have some basic cooking knowledge by performing the following duties.

Includes the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

Distribute menus, collect diet sheets, and deliver food trays and snacks to nursing units or directly to residents.

Portion and wrap the food or place it directly on plates for service to residents.

Prepare and serve a variety of beverages such as coffee, tea, and soft drinks.

Package take-out foods or serve food to residents.

Work on assembly lines adding cutlery, napkins, food, and other items to trays.

Weigh or measure ingredients.

Place food trays over food warmers for immediate service or store them in refrigerated storage cabinets.

Wash, peel, and cut various foods, such as fruits and vegetables, to prepare for serving.

Mix ingredients for green salads, molded fruit salads, vegetable salads, and pasta salads.

Store food in designated containers and storage areas to prevent spoilage.

Clean and sanitize work areas, equipment, utensils, dishes, or silverware.

Use manual or electric appliances to clean, peel, slice, and trim foods.

Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

Less than high school education; or up to 1-month related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package and paid time off.

JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
JOB SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Charge Nurse, and/or Director of Health Services, the Medical Technician is responsible for performing routine patient/resident care and med pass according to policies and procedures and within acceptable nursing standards.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.


ï‚· Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.Â 

ï‚· Communicates with the residentâ€™s health care providers, supervisor, family members/significant others, and the resident regarding health conditions and both prescription and non-prescription medication needs.

ï‚· Ensures that the available medications coincide with what the authorized prescriber (e.g. physician) has prescribed.Â 

ï‚· Knows the basic rules and precautions of medication assistance. Manages medications and assists the resident to self-administer medications.

ï‚· Follows infection control techniques in performing patient/resident care.Â 

ï‚· Understands the guidelines for the proper storage, security and documentation of centrally stored medications.Â 

ï‚· Follows the process used for medication ordering, refills and the receipt of medications from the pharmacy.Â 

ï‚· Logs all medications on community-approved medication log when received.Â 

ï‚· Destroys medications as needed and in accordance with state and community procedures.Â 

ï‚· Documents all communication with prescribers, family/significant others, and the resident according to your community policy.Â 

ï‚· Continual observation of each resident for potential adverse reactions to medications and/or signs/symptoms indicating the need for a change to the medication regime.Â 

ï‚· May assist community with caregiver functions.Â 

ï‚· Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.Â 

ï‚· Follows highest standards of cleanliness. Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of medication.

ï‚· Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.Â 

ï‚· Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required. ï‚· For unlicensed staff that assist with the self-administration of medications, a total of twenty four (24) hours of training shall be provided within the first four weeks of employment. Sixteen (16) hours of hands-on shadowing and eight (8) hours of instruction shall be completed prior to assisting with the self-administration of medications. Four (4) hours of in-service training on medication related issues shall be completed in each succeeding 12 month period.Â

JobPostingExport.Description: Licensed Vocational Nurse - Full Time - $41/hr Sta
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Webster House


Functions independently in performing the nursing process through ongoing assessment, planning, intervention and evaluation of safe therapeutic care for patients overt and covert needs and/or complications of treatment during his or her assigned shift. Provides direction to ancillary members of the health care team. Works cooperatively with the Registered Nurse and other members of the health care team to complete and revise the Minimum Data Set.

Responsibilities

  • The Licensed Vocational Nurse demonstrates proficiency in performing all nursing skills, knowledge of procedures and protocols, safe and efficient use of specialized equipment, and accurate administration of medications.
  • Completes assignments in a timely fashion including maintenance of equipment and supplies necessary for provision of patient care, Medication stock, and Medical Surgical supplies
  • Coordinates patient care activities with other nursing staff and physicians
  • The Licensed Vocational Nurse identifies any changes in patient status and reports to the appropriate health care professional.
  • Handles all resident contacts in a courteous, professional manner and receives, places, and transfers calls using appropriate telephone etiquette
  • Assists in orientation of new staff by sharing knowledge, experiences and acting as a preceptor or mentor
  • The Licensed Vocational Nurse completes notification forms according to protocol and notifies appropriate personnel, and performs any other duties as assigned.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Ability to deal with patients from ages 55 to 120
  • Ability to work well with others and perform a variety of assigned duties


Education and Qualifications

  • Current license to practice as a Licensed Vocational Nurse in the state of California
  • One year of experience in either acute care or long term care preferred
  • Current CPR certification

JobPostingExport.Description: Certified Nurse Assistant I - Full Time - $25/hr S
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Webster House

Summary: Reporting to the Charge Nurse, the Certified Nursing Assistant provides direct care to residents of the skilled nursing facility in accordance with standards of practice and regulatory requirements of the Department of Health Services.

Responsibilities

  • The Certified Nursing Assistant ensures quality nursing and wellness care to the residents in Skilled Nursing.
  • Assists in preparation of nursing unit, resident rooms, and beds
  • Assists in and may accompany resident in the admission, transfer and discharge procedure
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant assists residents in the activities of daily living, including oral hygiene, nail care, transfers, and mobility.
  • Provides wheelchair transportation and assists in ambulation residents as needed
  • Encourages residents to participate in activities
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant is responsible for maintaining order and safety in resident living areas.
  • Assures maximum functioning of resident through range of motion activities, toileting schedule, and the feeding and turning schedule
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant observes residents for any physical and behavioral changes and reports them to the charge nurse, and is a mandatory reporter for all suspected abuse situations.
  • Participates in all staff meetings, and other meetings as necessary
  • Records all pertinent information pertaining to the daily care of residents, including weights, activities of daily living, intake and output, and reports this information to charge nurse
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant observes and reports any needed repairs or service for building or equipment to charge nurse.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Ability to read, speak well and be understood clearly in the English language
  • Bilingual ability preferred

Education and Qualifications

  • Current California CNA certification
  • At least six months experience as a CNA in acute or long term care setting of written reference from CNA program instructor
  • Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification
  • High school diploma or equivalent

  • The Certified Nursing Assistant is responsible for maintaining order and safety in resident living areas.
  • Assures maximum functioning of resident through range of motion activities, toileting schedule, and the feeding and turning schedule
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant observes residents for any physical and behavioral changes and reports them to the charge nurse, and is a mandatory reporter for all suspected abuse situations.
  • Participates in all staff meetings, and other meetings as necessary
  • Records all pertinent information pertaining to the daily care of residents, including weights, activities of daily living, intake and output, and reports this information to charge nurse
  • The Certified Nursing Assistant observes and reports any needed repairs or service for building or equipment to charge nurse.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Ability to read, speak well and be understood clearly in the English language
  • Bilingual ability preferred

Education and Qualifications

  • Current California CNA certification
  • At least six months experience as a CNA in acute or long term care setting of written reference from CNA program instructor
  • Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification
  • High school diploma or equivalent

JOB SUMMARY

Receives callers at community/office, determines nature of business, and directs callers to destination by performing the following duties.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Include the following. Other duties may be assigned as necessary.

  • Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

  • Greet incoming visitors, screen visitors in lobby if unfamiliar.

  • May cash checks; sell stamps, bill residents for meal charges by entering data on computer system.
  • May sell meal tickets to employees and issues visitors pass when required.
  • May make guest room reservations.
  • Monitor fire alarms, call 911 if applicable and direct emergency personnel.
  • Keep track of keys to residents, employees and vendors.
  • Performs variety of clerical duties, which may include various projects for the Executive Director, Marketing, Accounting and Activity Departments.
  • Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.
  • Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures.

JOB REQUIREMENTS and QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.Â  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities required.   • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos; ability to write simple correspondence; ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
  • Ability to add and subtract two digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10's and 100's; ability to perform these operations uses units of American money and weight measurement, volume, and distance.
  • Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form; ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
  • Knowledge of multi-line telephones, telephone head set, calculator, fax machine and postal machine.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS and WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Regularly required to sit and talk or hear.
  • Required to walk and use hands to finger, handle, or feel.
  • Occasionally required to stand; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and taste or smell.Â 
  • Frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
JOB SUMMARY: Keeps the facility in clean and orderly condition by performing the following duties. Additionally assists with maintenance tasks as assigned.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES including the following. Other duties may also be assigned.

Assists the maintenance workers with work orders as requested or assigned by supervisor; including light maintenance functions included in the renovation of resident living units.

Sweeps, mops, scrubs and vacuums hallways, stairs, common areas, empty units, elevators and office space, etc...

Waxes and buffs floors / shampoos carpet

Cleans laundry room(s) and public restroom(s)

Empties trash and garbage containers and sanitizes garbage rooms and shoots

Notifies management concerning need for repairs or replacements of lighting, heating and ventilating equipment.

Walks grounds and pick up debris and litter. Empties ashtrays, sweeps/blows sidewalks, and assists in the maintenance of the landscape and grounds.

Assists with scheduled inspections of apartments required by regulatory agencies.

Assists with the scheduling of the preventative cleaning schedule

Assist with special events by setting up tables and chairs, moving equipment and boxes, etc.

Assists the maintenance workers with work orders as requested or assigned by supervisor; including light maintenance functions included in the renovation of units.

QUALIFICATION REQUIRMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may e made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: High school education preferred but not required; or up to six months related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

LANGUAGE SKILLS; Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS; Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out detailed buy uninvolved written or oral instructions Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to hold objects, tools, or equipment. The employee frequently is required to walk, reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance, talk or hear, and taste or smell.

The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 90 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

JOB SUMMARY: Installs, maintains, and repairs machinery, equipment, physical structures, and plumbing by performing the following duties.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following duties. Other duties may be assigned:

  • Visually inspects and tests electrical equipment, refrigeration units, boilers, vacuum cleaners, washers and dryers, air conditioning, heating units, appliances, etc. Performs repairs as appropriate.
  • Listens for unusual sounds from machines or equipment to detect malfunction and discusses machine operation variations with supervisor or other maintenance workers to diagnose problem or repair machine.
  • Dismantles defective machines, appliances and equipment and installs new or repaired parts.
  • Cleans and lubricates shafts, bearings, gears, and other parts of machinery.
  • Performs plumbing repairs and maintenance.
  • Masonry work may be required.
  • Repairs and maintains physical structure of the facility.
  • Repairs counters, benches, partitions, and other wooden structures.
  • Does refurbishing work in resident apartments such as pulling up carpets, caulking and tile work, painting, etc.
  • Responds to and completes work orders for individual apartment units and common areas of the building and grounds.
  • Works with vendors who may be engaged to perform various service functions which relate to the maintenance of client facilities
  • Assists with special events by setting up tables and chairs, moving equipment and boxes, etc.
  • Responds to emergency clean up assignments, working with or in the absence of the janitorial staff.
  • Inspects emergency equipment such as fire alarms and extinguishers, smoke and heat detectors, and sprinkler systems.
  • Performs pipe and duct cleaning and cleans exterior lights, doors and windows.
  • Keep records of work performed
  • Assists in the planning, development and monitoring of the Preventative Maintenance Plan and the Comprehensive Needs Assessment
  • Suggests changes in working conditions and use of equipment to increase efficiency of work crews
  • Requisitions and inventories all equipment and tools needed to carry out maintenance and cleaning functions
  • Assists in the routine inspections of apartments and common areas
  • Communicates on a regular basis with his/her supervisor regarding the needs, plans and monitoring of the maintenance and janitorial service functions
  • Assists in the training of newly hired maintenance and janitorial staff

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: High school education preferred but not required. Two to four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Must be willing and able to work on-call to respond to maintenance and resident emergencies. Position may require the employee to live on site. (This should be determined by each community's special staffing circumstances.)
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to hold objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit, climb or balance, talk or hear, and taste or smell.
  • The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 90 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Brief Description

Resident Relations and liaison with management for the coordination and linkage of community, supportive and medical services for residents of affordable housing communities. Conducts resident assessments and education for resident, family and staff.

Description

Resident Relations and liaison with management for the coordination and linkage of community, supportive and medical services for residents of affordable housing communities. Conducts resident assessments and education for resident, family and staff.

Responsibilities

  • The Resident Services Coordinator facilitates the entry of new residents to the community by providing orientation to the apartment, community services such as (but not limited to) housekeeping, maintenance, dining, transportation, security, nursing, chaplaincy, programs and events, and Life Care Contract provisions.
  • Provides individual listening and advisory services to residents. Assists resident in locating support services for personal concerns such as anxiety, bereavement, and depression. Reviews notes and information collected to identify problems and concerns, to define goals, and makes recommendations to management. Interacts with other staff to discuss available solutions, new resources or techniques, and to share information. Provides support to residents and families when a move to higher level of care is necessary.
  • The Resident Services Coordinator promptly reports noticeable environmental or equipment repair needs to the maintenance department. Advises residents and management of safety hazards posed by a cluttered apartment and implements policy to bring condition of the apartment into compliance. Prepares risk reports for management with suggestions to prevent or minimize loss.
  • May help resident access outside services including financial management or a psychologist, if needed. Contacts vendors and operating departments on behalf of residents to ensure that services, supplies, and equipment are received by promised date. May inspect products/services for quality and quantity to ensure adherence to specifications and resident satisfaction.
  • Contacts responsible parties to plan resident moves to higher levels of care or out of the building within the community time guidelines for apartment turn over.
  • Explains policy, procedure and residents rights; addresses resident concerns and performs other forms of resident/administrative liaison. Organizes information obtained from residents into memo form. Examines records such as bills and related documents and correspondence, and converses or corresponds with resident and staff to obtain facts regarding resident complaint. May trace missing deliveries. May investigate overdue service completion. Notifies resident and designated staff of findings, adjustments, and recommendations such as refund of money, credit of resident's account, or adjustment of resident's bill. May follow up on recommended adjustments to ensure resident satisfaction. Recommends improvements in services, policies, or procedures to prevent future complaints of similar nature to management.
  • The Resident Services Coordinator assists with new staff orientation in the areas of new resident orientation, resident rights, and resident confidentiality.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Compassionate, supportive, and emotionally mature professional, able to remain responsive to resident needs while attending to multiple tasks
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with residents, families, vendors, and the interdisciplinary care team
  • Ability to understand and uphold policies, procedures and regulations applicable to different levels of care

Education and Qualifications

  • BA in Human Services or Business fields
  • Two years experience in an equivalent position
  • Extensive experience in coaching, counseling and problem solving

Summary:
Under the direction of the Director of Resident Services/Charge Nurse or designee, the CNA is responsible for performing routine patient/resident care according to policies and procedures and within acceptable nursing standards.

Responsibilities:

Â· Practices quality nursing and wellness care to residents of Skilled Nursing

JobPostingExport.Description: Resident Services Coordinator - San Jose Area
JobPostingExport.PositionDescription:
Shires Memorial Center-AH

Summary:

The Resident Services Coordinator (RSC) is responsible for assessing and identifying resident needs that focuses on housing success. The RSC will work in a proactive manner to link elderly, people with disabilities and low-income families to supportive services and other community resources. This position must be in full compliance with HIPPA.

Responsibilities:

Â· Provide non-clinical case management and referral services to all resident site (s), which includes securing the full range of social services as needed by individual residents.

Â· Assess and identify resident needs, develop and implement individual healthy aging plans, actively motivate and educate residents on self-management of chronic conditions, and in close collaboration with hospitals and nursing homes.

Â· Conduct initial assessment within 30 days of moved-in and update assessment including update Intake, Individual, ADL annually or as needed on ADL.

Â· Utilize and maintain accurate and timely documentation through AASC On-Line. Conduct initial resident assessment within 30 days of move in. Update assessment as needed. Submission of weekly report to housing administrator and supervisor.

Â· Organize and coordinate on-site wellness and health improvement programs, events and activities. Educate residents on wellness programs such as service availability, benefits, fall prevention, chronic diseases or tools for healthy living.

Â· Produce weekly report and timely submit to Housing Administrator, immediate supervisor, and contractorâ€™s request and HUD annual SfS (Standards for Success) Report.

Â· Conduct outreach and engagement, monitoring service periodically, home visits when needed.

Â· Work closely with Activities Coordinator (if applicable) to develop a wide range of activities within and outside the site, designed to build community and provide opportunities for socialization and wellness that is mutually beneficial to residents.

Â· Create with volunteer to establish volunteer support programs.

Â· Collaborate and sustain constructive relationships with residents and their families, service providers, organization staff, especially those in property management.

Â· Maintain accurately and timely documentation on all resident demographics, issues, requests, incidents, interactions and outcomes through online software (AASC Online).

Â· Maintain updated residentsâ€™ files and resources directory through online software (AASC Online).

Â· Attend staff meeting and Resident Services Coordinator on-going training and/or conference.

Â· Assist residents in identifying and accessing needed services and benefits, and serve as a liaison or advocate for residents when help is needed to secure resources.

Â· Maintain resident confidentiality with the resident population according to set guidelines. Report incidents of abuse and neglect to Adult and Child Protective Services as required by law.

Â· Establish informal and formal partnerships with health and supportive service agencies in the community to ensure that services are available and delivered in a timely and efficient manner.

Â· Produce program materials such as Periodic Resident Newsletter.

Â· Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Â· Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication, listening, facilitation, problem solving, and decision making skills.

Â· Maintain professional boundaries, including exercising objectivity and confidentiality, while building trusting relationships with residents and staff.

Â· Basic computer proficiency, including ability to maintain data in an electronic database, communicate via e-mail, use internet and operate word processing software to create program materials.

Â· Cultural competency in working with diverse populations and individuals from different ethnic and racial backgrounds, including working with non-English speaking adults.

Â· Self-direct and work independently, but also function well as part of a team.

Â· Experience building relationships and partnerships with local service providers, community institutions and government agencies.

Â· Understanding of affordable housing operations and fair housing practices.

Â· Respect for and comfort with allowing individuals to make their own decisions and prioritize their own care goals.

Â· Ability to multi-task and establish priorities in a sometimes busy and stressful environment.

Education and Qualifications:

Â· Bachelorâ€™s degree in Social Work, Sociology, Psychology, Gerontology, or related field or equivalent experience.

Â· Experience with or knowledge of HUD regulatory requirements is plus.

Â· Excellent written and oral communication required. Additional ability to speak other languages such as Cantonese, Mandarin, Spanish or Farsi is a plus. Note: Some properties require fluency in specific languages.

Â· Basic computer skills including ability to navigate the internet, use Outlook, create Word and Excel documents, and work with a web-based database.

Â· Must complete annual online training through learning management system and offsite in-person trainings as required.

Â· CA Driver License requiredâ€”driving to various sites is required

Work Environment and Physical and Mental Requirements, and Other Requirements:

Â· The work environment and characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The work environment is an office environment, community meeting room, or a residentâ€™s apartment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Â· While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and to hear and speak with peers and residents. The employee is often required to move continually throughout the work day; maintain dexterity to pinch small objects; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, climb, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Â· Able to drive 30% of the time to residentsâ€™ apartments throughout the region (mileage reimbursed at current federal rate). Able to tolerate possible exposure to fumes, dust and other environmental elements.

Â· This job is primarily conducted in an office environment where noise and temperature variations are minimal and casual business attire is required.

Â· Must be able to work under time demands and remain calm and professional with a wide variety of personalities.

Â· Simple grasping and fine manipulation, sitting at a desk while using a computer, and using a telephone or extended periods of time.

Â· Intermittently twisting to reach objects near the desk, standing, walking, bending, reaching, using a computer, and lifting or moving objects which may weigh up to 25-30 pounds.

Â· Must have the ability to maintain professional boundaries, including exercising objectivity, while building trusting relationships with residents and staff.

Exposure Risk:

Â· The Resident Services Coordinator is at possible risk for exposure to blood and body fluids.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

    The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
